boot.title: Connection Tips
boot.description: We couldn't communicate with the board. Try putting your ESP32 into bootloader mode:

steps.step1: Press and hold the BOOT (GPIO0) button and keep it held down.
steps.step2: Tap RESET, then release only the RESET button.
steps.step3: While still holding BOOT, click Connect.
steps.step4: Release the BOOT button once the log shows the ESP-ROM banner or the connection completes.

aboutPage.title: About ESPConnect
aboutPage.intro1: ESPConnect is a browser-based toolkit for ESP32 devices. It brings common maintenance tasks together so you can connect, inspect and update your board without installing desktop utilities.
aboutPage.intro2: The application talks to the device over the Web Serial API, then exposes high-level tools for firmware flashing, partition management, filesystem editing, backup/restore workflows, as well as a session log and serial monitor for troubleshooting. It is based on Jason2866's WebSerial ESPTool.

filesystem.spiffs: SPIFFS: TypeScript emulator for staging changes locally before writing flash.
filesystem.littlefs: LittleFS: Backed by the littlefs-wasm module for true storage parity.
filesystem.fatfs: FATFS: New wasm-powered tooling for FAT partitions, mirroring your device layout.
filesystem.uploads: Drag-and-drop uploads, preview/listen for common file types, diff summaries, and mandatory backups before saving keep the workflow safe.

firmware.flash: Flash custom binaries with progress tracking, presets, and safety prompts.
firmware.inspect: Inspect partition tables, OTA slots, device descriptors, and flash usage at a glance.
firmware.monitor: Serial monitor with command shortcuts and session logging for troubleshooting.

aboutPage.safety: Every destructive action is gated behind confirmation prompts and recent backups. ESPConnect keeps staged changes in-memory until you explicitly write them to flash, making it easy to review modifications or revert by re-reading the partition.
aboutPage.privacy: ESPConnect runs fully in your browser -- there is no backend, account, or telemetry. Firmware files, backups, and diagnostics stay local and only move when you download them yourself. Always flash firmware from trusted sources.
